film_condensed: Slaves are briefed on sugar cane harvesting.
reality_condensed: Northup harvested cane during the season.

film_condensed: The plantation owner supervises the slaves.
reality_condensed: Slaves were closely supervised.

film_condensed: The slaves sleep on the floor.
reality_condensed: Northup was never allowed more than a blanket for sleeping.

film_condensed: Northup tries to make pen & ink.
reality_condensed: Northup tried numerous means of creating pen & ink.

film_condensed: Northup tries to write a letter, fails.
reality_condensed: Northup tried to write letters with various materials.

film_condensed: Northup pleasures a slave woman.
reality_condensed: Made up by the filmmakers.

film_condensed: Flashback - Northup gazes into his wife's eyes.
reality_condensed: Northup & his wife were deeply in love.

film_condensed: Northup plays his violin.
reality_condensed: Northup was an accomplished violinist.

film_condensed: Northup performs at a posh white party.
reality_condensed: Northup played at events throughout the season.

film_condensed: Northup tucks his 2 kids in.
reality_condensed: Northup had 3 kids.

film_condensed: Anne is going away for a few weeks for work.
reality_condensed: Anne worked away as a chef occasionally.

film_condensed: Northup waves goodbye to his family.
reality_condensed: The kids went away with Anne.

film_condensed: Moon introduces Northup to Brown  & Hamilton.
reality_condensed: Northup met Brown  & Hamilton, but not through Moon.

film_condensed: They persuade him to join them as a travelling musician.
reality_condensed: Northup accepted the offer, it was good money.

film_condensed: They arrive in Washington.
reality_condensed: They went to Washington.

film_condensed: They toast their success, refilling Northup's glass.
reality_condensed: They were successful  & happy about it.

film_condensed: Northup wakes up chained in a dungeon.
reality_condensed: Northup was drugged, awoke in a dungeon.

film_condensed: Northup protests his capture to Burch.
reality_condensed: Northup refused to accept he was no longer free.

film_condensed: Radburn gives Northup a clean shirt.
reality_condensed: Slaves for sale were kept presentable.

film_condensed: Northup  & others made to wash naked outside.
reality_condensed: The slaves had to sponge off under supervision.

film_condensed: Northup talks to others, tries to find a solution.
reality_condensed: Northup discussed escape options with two others.

film_condensed: Eliza  & her daughter are thrown in to the pen.
reality_condensed: Eliza  & her daughter were added to the sale group.

film_condensed: The captives are lined up.
reality_condensed: Northup  & the others were lined up for travel.

film_condensed: They arrive at a dock, moved onto a boat.
reality_condensed: They were sent to the docks on a wagon.

film_condensed: Ray warns Northup to keep his identity quiet.
reality_condensed: Ray advised Northup not to tell people who he was.

film_condensed: A captor removes a muzzle from Roberts.
reality_condensed: We couldn't find a source for this.

film_condensed: Northup, Ray  & Robert plan their escape.
reality_condensed: Northup, Robert  & Arthur discussed escaping.

film_condensed: Robert protects Eliza from rape, is stabbed to death.
reality_condensed: Robert died of smallpox.

film_condensed: Northup  & Ray push Robert's body overboard.
reality_condensed: A sailor pushed the body overboard.

film_condensed: Ray's master awaits at the docks, claims him.
reality_condensed: Arthur was rescued by his friends at the dock.

film_condensed: Northup sits looking at the slaves around him.
reality_condensed: There were at least 50 waiting to be sold.

film_condensed: Flashback - Northup shopping with his rich happy family.
reality_condensed: The Northups shopped at Parkers.

film_condensed: A slave enters the shop, his master apologises.
reality_condensed: We couldn't find a source for this.

film_condensed: Northup gets a slap when he doesn't respond to his slave name.
reality_condensed: Nobody knew who Platt was supposed to be = confusion.

film_condensed: Freeman slaps slave flesh like livestock.
reality_condensed: Freeman checked their 'soundness' like animals.

film_condensed: Freeman exhibits his 'stock' to buyers.
reality_condensed: Freeman arranged his 'stock' carefully for viewing.

film_condensed: Ford wants to buy Eliza  & Northup.
reality_condensed: Ford did want to buy Eliza  & Northup.

film_condensed: Freeman sells Eliza's son, Eliza begs they not be separated.
reality_condensed: Randall was sold despite Eliza's begging.

film_condensed: Ford offers to buy Eliza's daughter, Freeman refuses.
reality_condensed: Freeman kept Eliza's light-skinned daughter, a valuable girl.

film_condensed: They arrive at Ford's, told to rest  & eat.
reality_condensed: Ford's slaves were rested  & fed on arrival.

film_condensed: Tibeats  & Chapin brief the slaves.
reality_condensed: Tibeats was chief carpenter  & Chapin overseer.

film_condensed: The slaves chop tries, saw wood etc.
reality_condensed: Timber felling was the main job at Ford's.

film_condensed: Ford reads the slaves bible passages.
reality_condensed: Ford read the bible to his slaves every sabbath.

film_condensed: The slaves meet a group of Native Americans in the woods.
reality_condensed: Northup often joined the Native Americans, watched them dance.

film_condensed: Tibeats  & Northup debate a plan, Ford choses Northup's plan.
reality_condensed: Ford did choose Northup's idea.

film_condensed: Northup's plan works, he's highly praised.
reality_condensed: Ford praised Northup  & the other slaves cheered him.

film_condensed: Ford gives Northup a violin.
reality_condensed: Ford didn't give Northup a violin.

film_condensed: Eliza weeps for her children.
reality_condensed: Eliza wept constantly for her children.

film_condensed: Eliza weeps as Ford reads from the bible.
reality_condensed: Eliza wept constantly.

film_condensed: Tibeats antagonises Northup.
reality_condensed: Tibeats was constantly on Northup's back.

film_condensed: Two men drag Eliza away, she's sobbing.
reality_condensed: Eliza was often sobbing,  & was moved from job to job as a result.

film_condensed: Flashback - Eliza talks of her early life as a pampered slave, it how it ended.
reality_condensed: Eliza's previous master was in love with her. His daughter sent her away.

film_condensed: Tibeats goes to whip Northup for nothing, Northup attacks him.
reality_condensed: Northup retaliated  & totally lost it.

film_condensed: Chapin intervenes, Tibeats runs off.
reality_condensed: Chapin was sympathetic to Northup.

film_condensed: Tibeats returns with two men.
reality_condensed: Tibeats came back with two friends from nearby plantations.

film_condensed: They put a noose around Northup's neck, start hoisting.
reality_condensed: They would have hung Northup if Chapin hadn't stopped them.

film_condensed: Northup is left dangling for a really long time.
reality_condensed: Northup wasn't hanging by his neck, but was left tied for many hours.

film_condensed: Ford gallops over  & slashes the rope.
reality_condensed: Ford galloped in, cut Northup's ropes.

film_condensed: Northup rests in the great house as Ford guards him.
reality_condensed: Chapin guarded Northup as he rested in the great house.

film_condensed: Northup tells Ford he's a freeman, Ford won't hear it.
reality_condensed: Northup never told Ford of his status.

film_condensed: Epps insists the bible prescribes lashes for disobedient slaves.
reality_condensed: Tanner gave this speech, not Epps.

film_condensed: Northup picks cotton, an overseer cracks the whip.
reality_condensed: The whip was cracked all day at Epps'.

film_condensed: Epps' predeliction for Patsey becomes apparent.
reality_condensed: Epps lusted after Patsey.

film_condensed: Northup is whipped for his low cotton yield.
reality_condensed: The slaves were whipped for low yields.

film_condensed: Patsey sits weaving dollies.
reality_condensed: We couldn't find a source for this.

film_condensed: Epps storms the slave huts at night, demanding dancing.
reality_condensed: Epps frequently demanded dance parties.

film_condensed: Northup plays violin while other slaves are made to dance.
reality_condensed: Epps made them dance while Northup played.

film_condensed: Epps' wife throws a decanter at Patsey's face.
reality_condensed: Mrs Epps often threw broken bottles etc at Patsey.

film_condensed: Epps' wife sends Northup for groceries.
reality_condensed: Northup fetched groceries for Mrs Epps.

film_condensed: Northup stumbles upon a lynching.
reality_condensed: We couldn't find a source for this.

film_condensed: Northup reaches Bartholemew's store.
reality_condensed: Northup picked things up from the store often.

film_condensed: Mrs Epps asks if there was any trouble, Northup lies no.
reality_condensed: No trouble for Northup to lie about.

film_condensed: North fetches Patsey from Mrs Shaw's, where they all sit  & have tea.
reality_condensed: This scene was invented to give Mrs Shaw a voice.

film_condensed: Northup tells Patsey to walk away from Epps. Epps starts a fight with him.
reality_condensed: Epps started a fight in a jealous rage.

film_condensed: Northup lies contemplating in his hut.
reality_condensed: Northup contemplated his situation near constantly.

film_condensed: Epps rapes Patsey.
reality_condensed: Epps repeatedly raped & beat Patsey.

film_condensed: Northup notes Mrs Epps has ordered paper from the store.
reality_condensed: Northup noticed paper in his grocery collection.

film_condensed: Northup steals a sheet of paper, hides it.
reality_condensed: Northup stole a sheet of paper, hid it under boards.

film_condensed: Mrs Epps offers treats to all but Patsey, demands Patsey beaten.
reality_condensed: Mrs Epps treated Patsey with violent jealousy.

film_condensed: Patsey begs Northup to drown her.
reality_condensed: Mrs Epps asked Northup to drown Patsey.

film_condensed: Epps' fields are barren, blames the slaves.
reality_condensed: The harvest was poor but we don't know who he blamed.

film_condensed: The pickers are rented to Judge Turner.
reality_condensed: Northup was rented to Turner for a season.

film_condensed: Flashback to failed letter-writing scene.
reality_condensed: Northup tried many times to write a letter.

film_condensed: Turner says Northuo can keep proceeds from violin performances.
reality_condensed: Turner allowed Northup to keep proceeds from fiddling.

film_condensed: Northup carves his family's names into his violin.
reality_condensed: He doesn't mention carving their names.

film_condensed: Northup plays fiddle at a masked ball.
reality_condensed: He played at various events through the season.

film_condensed: Epps has a little black girl with him, his  & Patsey's daughter?
reality_condensed: We couldn't find a source for this.

film_condensed: A white man joins the cotton pickers.
reality_condensed: A white man hoping to be overseer was put with the pickers.

film_condensed: Armbsy is scolded for his low yield.
reality_condensed: We couldn't find a source for this.

film_condensed: Armbsy expresses sympathy for slaves to Northup.
reality_condensed: Armsby said enough for Nothup to risk trusting him.

film_condensed: Northup pays Armbsy to mail a lettter.
reality_condensed: Northup offered Armbsy his fiddling money to mail a letter.

film_condensed: Northup gets to writing a letter.
reality_condensed: Northup wrote a letter with boiled maple juice  & a duck feather.

film_condensed: Armbsy turns Northup in, Epps challenges him. Northup gets out of it.
reality_condensed: Armsby turned Northup in, but he persuaded Epps Armsby was lying.

film_condensed: Northup burns the letter.
reality_condensed: Northup burnt the letter, afraid of being caught with it.

film_condensed: Abram collapses in the field, dies.
reality_condensed: Abram didn't die during Northup's tenure as a slave.

film_condensed: Northup buries Abram.
reality_condensed: Abram didn't die during Northup's tenure as a slave.

film_condensed: The slaves sing by Abram's graveside.
reality_condensed: Abram didn't die during Northup's tenure as a slave.

film_condensed: Bass debates the ethics of slavery with Epps.
reality_condensed: Bass was anti-slavery  & argued it everywhere.

film_condensed: Epps can't find Patsey, he's enraged.
reality_condensed: Patsey was missing for a few hours.

film_condensed: Patsey returns, Epps forces Northup to lash her.
reality_condensed: Northup was made to lash Patsey on her return.

film_condensed: The women clean Patsey's wounds.
reality_condensed: Patsey's wounds were tended with melted tallow.

film_condensed: Northup destroys his violin.
reality_condensed: We couldn't find a source for this.

film_condensed: Northup asks Bass for help, he agrees.
reality_condensed: Northup persuaded Bass to write to his friends.

film_condensed: Time passes. Northup waits in agony.
reality_condensed: A lot of time passed, Northup began to give up.

film_condensed: The sheriff arrives with Parker, rescue Northup.
reality_condensed: Henry Northup  & the sheriff rescued Northup.

film_condensed: Patsey  & Northup embrace.
reality_condensed: Patsey embraced Northup as he left.

film_condensed: Northup rejoins his family, including a new grandson.
reality_condensed: Northup was reunited with his family. His grandson was named after him.

film_condensed: Northup never got justice.
reality_condensed: Northup never got justice.
